results.title: Zulu
results.creator_credit: Cy Endfield, Sir Stanley Baker, Diamond Films, Joseph E. Levine and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: One of the most popular British films of the 1960’s, “Zulu” is based on the true story of the defence of Rorke’s Drift in 1879. In this battle, 1200 men of the South Wales Borderers confronted four thousand attacking Zulu warriors. A stunning, historically accurate, battle picture starring the great British actors Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins and Michael Caine in his first screen role. A movie of “epic” proportions, the long and bloody battle is depicted in meticulous detail. The Zulus, who had never seen a motion picture, were shown an old Roy Rogers western to assist their performance. The Zulu chief is played by the real-life Chief Buthelezzi.

results.title: Outland
results.creator_credit: Peter Hyams, Richard Roth and The Ladd Company
results.brief_description: On Io, the innermost moon of Jupiter, the volcanic landscape is desolate. For the Con-Am 27 mining colony, populated by misfits and losers, it is home. Violence bubbles benath the surface, ready to explode. Federal District Marshall, William T. O’Niel, (Sean Connery), is sent to investigate the grisly, frenzied deaths amongst the miners, and must struggle alone in the pursuit of truth. This is a grim view of the future, where productivity takes precendence over humanity.

results.title: Pale rider
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood stars in this classic tale of right, wrong and retribution which takes place in a corrupt and violent gold rush town. The local miners are trying to fend off a take-over attempt from a powerful mining syndicate. Corporate mining boss, Coy LaHood offers the miners a deal: get out or be carried out. The miners have little choice until a mysterious stranger rides into town. The miners call him the Preacher. La Hood hires a band of thugs to kill the Preacher and the miners, but even though he pays in gold he hasn’t reckoned on the Preacher, who pays off in lead! Dark, funny and quietly sophisticated, “Pale Rider” reinterprets the Western in a manner that shamelessly combines melodrama, myth and irony.

results.title: Hello, Dolly!
results.creator_credit: Gene Kelly, Ernest Lehman, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Chenault
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is a knockout as Dolly Levi, the woman “who arranges things… like furniture and daffodils and lives”. The plot concerns Dolly, a young widow and professional matchmaker, who sets her sights and whatever else she can muster, on conquering tight-fisted Yonkers merchant, Horace Vandergelder, beautifully played by Walter Matthau. Spend a magical evening with the incomparabale Barbra and enjoy a great musical. Co-starring Michael Crawford.

results.title: The Prince and the showgirl
results.creator_credit: Jack Harris, Terence Rattigan, Laurence Olivier, L O P Ltd and Marilyn Monroe Productions
results.brief_description: A dazzling American showgirl, (Marilyn Monroe) catches the monacled eye of a debonair prince, (Laurence Olivier). Opposites attract as His Higness Grand Duke Charles succumbs to the unpolished but vivacious Milwaukee chorus girl Elsie Marina, abandoning his “stuffed shirt” posture for her more commonsense approach to life. While the Prince’s state is beset by political worries, he seeks escape in an affair of the heart. Elsie is also interested in affairs, but in the affairs of State. When she pits her “Yankee” ingenuity against the Balkan bigwigs who want to remove Charles, they are no match. Monroe radiates beauty and charm, while Olivier is the perfect counterpart as the straight-man in this romantic comedy.

results.title: Stark
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Timothy White, David Parker, Michael Wearing, Film Victoria and Cascade Ash
results.brief_description: Stark, the most powerful secret society on Earth could buy the Earth a thousand times and still make a takeover bid on God. So why is Stark desperate to buy a large slab of Aboriginal land in the Australian outback? CD, (Ben Elton), doesn’t care about the world, but he does care about getting laid, especially by Rachel, (Jacqueline McKenzie), a beautiful rebel looking for a cause. Together with Zimmerman and Walter, two Vietnam veterans, dippy hippy Karen and Christie Kettel, a New York journalist, they take on Stark to try and save the world from a toxic conspiracy. Filmed entirely in Australia, Stark combines Ben Elton’s brash, individual humour with a serious environmental message.

results.title: Black rain
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Sherry Lansing, Stanley R. Jaffe and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Nick Conklin, (Michael Douglas) and Charlie Douglas, (Andy Garcia) are strangers in a strange land. They are New York City cops in Japan, chasing Sato, (Yasuka Matsuda), an escaped murderer and a member of the Yakuza, (the Japanese Mafia). Director Ridley Scott takes the viewer on nightmare journey through the exotic, violent streets of Osaka, into the very heart of the deadly Yakuza. This fascinating thriller tells of men torn by a clash of culture and crime against honour.

results.title: Mwansa the Great
results.creator_credit: Rungano Nyoni, Gabriel Gauchet, ICreateFilms and UK Film Council
results.brief_description: A little boy sees himself as ‘Mwansa the great’, a full-grown warrior hunting lions. His little sister also visualises herself as an adult, ‘Princess Shula’ who is responsible for disciplining and looking after Mwansa.

results.title: Island people
results.creator_credit: Philip Leacock, John Taylor and Realist Film Unit (Great Britain)
results.brief_description:
How Six People Spend Saturday: “It is Saturday in Britain, the day divided between work and rest. In the morning six people, representative of various types, are seen at work in the industrial areas, on the farms and in the cities. They are a craftsman from the Midlands, a typist in a big Manchester office, a tug captain on the River Thames, a farmer from the Lowlands of Scotland, a woman doctor from Cardiff and a small boy who lives in a suburb.
At midday the people crowd out of offices, factories and schools, all going home to prepare for the half-holiday.
Saturday afternoon is set aside for enjoyment. Out they go to their games and amusements, to play football and hockey, rugby and running, to work in the garden, to walk in the woods. At the end of the afternoon they go out to various places of amusement, or they return home to read and play or to make clothes or model aeroplanes.” (Source: Films of Britain - British Council Film Department Catalogue - 1940)

results.title: The Silence of the lambs
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Ron Bozman, Kenneth Utt, Edward Saxon, Strongheart Films and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the best-selling novel by Thomas Harris, “Silence of the Lambs” is a disturbing and chilling thriller. The film which won five Academy Awards, is highlighted by the superb performances of Jodie Foster as FBI cadet Clarice Starling and Anthony Hopkins as the psychotic criminal, once brilliant psychiatrist, Dr. Hannibal “the Cannibal” Lecter. Starling’s job is to tap Lector’s mind in order to find the serial killer known as “Buffalo Bill”, a killer who skins his victims. Lector uses his macabre knowledge to entice Clarice into intricate but chilling mindgames. The film’s focal point is not so much the catching of the killer, but the relationship between Starling and Lector. The audience is manipulated so that Lecter is simultaneously repellent and charismatic, thus contributing to the tension and unease of the film.
